intro: Balaka tahitensis, commonly known as the Tahitian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Society Islands in French Polynesia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its flowers are often used in traditional Polynesian ceremonies. Balaka tahitensis thrives in coastal and tropical environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sunlight.
